What is VerusID, and what features does it offer?

VerusID is a self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable identity system that enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses. This means that users have full control over their digital identity and funds, and can revoke and recover their ID if needed.

As Verus PBaaS offers completely new capabilities that go beyond today’s decentralized platforms in many fundamental ways, the worldwide Verus community put its energy into creation, rather than convincing everyone that its capabilities are possible. Members across the Verus worldwide community have worked hard to make this all possible, and we are more than excited that you can now experience it firsthand. If you have an interest in the future of crypto, you owe it to yourself to learn about Verus, an unlimited scale, decentralized future with truth and privacy for all.### The Verus testnet, available in the Verus Desktop or cli wallets as the VRSCTEST coin, has the following capabilities, which to our knowledge are unique in crypto today.### Self sovereign, revocable, recoverable identities (currently on mainnet) VerusID
- Enables permissionless registration of friendly name strong identities and funds addresses that are simultaneously fully self-sovereign, revocable, and recoverable.
## Staking-capable time locking and theft prevention (Verus Vault)
- Enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked, but still allowing seamless staking of funds. When locked, a user specifies an unlock delay, typically long enough to notice when someone who might have compromised a user’s keys would have to unlock the ID before spending. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID. Users may also choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID as well. This enables virtually theft proof workflow and a solution to inheritance, trusts, vesting schedules, the 5$ wrench attack, and identity theft. What is Verus Vault, and how does it provide theft prevention?

Verus Vault is a staking-capable time locking feature that enables identities to be locked, preventing any funds under their control from being spent while locked. This provides theft prevention by specifying an unlock delay, allowing users to notice if someone has compromised their keys. The only way to circumvent the unlock delay is to revoke and recover an ID, and users can also choose to create and use fresh private keys when unlocking an ID.

How can VerusID be used in the context of cryptocurrency addresses?

VerusID can be used as a friendly name cryptocurrency address for all currencies on all Verus PBaaS blockchains in the Verus network, providing a convenient and secure way to manage identities and funds.
